title: uh rito..your "beginner" bots are better than the average low elo player
body:
their skillshots accuracy and pathing is usually better
they understand the basics like building mr vs ap comps when most low elo's don't

it's impossible to 1v2 beginner bots with most champs if u are low elo while it's fairly possible to 1v2 actual low elo players
what's the deal with this ? aren't they designed to be practice for BEGINNER players who might start out as low iron when they play ranked

not flaming low elo players i am the same as them just saying maybe beginner bots difficulty needs to be adjusted ? so they are actually bots for beginners and not pubstompers bots

replies.body: No... Those bots are a cakewalk and at least one of players should be able to 1v5 them by the end of match.

if you lane against one yes
if you lane against two... not really

I often play against the highest level of bots, just to get my Win of the Day mission. I can play against them 1v2 in lane, no problem. It's not fun, but it's perfectly doable. I suppose "Beginner" level is the lowest? This one is so utterly boring when you know how to play, I don't even want to touch it.

Bots have indeed good accuracy and pathing. On builds, I'm more skeptical, but I can believe real players are even worse in low MMR. But they have also a ton of glaring issues that no real player, even in low Iron, have.

Biggest one is, they have absolutely zero notion of commitment. If they are close to dying, they back away, even if their opponent is ALSO close to dying. They are also very bad at pushing their advantage and exploiting opportunities after killing someone. They don't push towers well, they don't group properly, they never take Baron or Dragon.

A full team of Iron5 players can probably lose *some* games against Beginner bots, but it won't be a "pubstomp", and I'd be amazed if real humans could get a lower than 50% winrate against bots. But anyway, what's the likelihood of people getting a full team of low Iron players in the first place?
Thatâ€™s probably just due to coding. Bots are meant to teach basics, like running away when low.
The "why" is not my point. My point is that bots are bad and properly suited opponents for beginners/low MMR players.

Look, in all honesty, if you think beginner bots are too good...
I don't know what to say ...

learn side stepping.. i guess..
low elo players don't side step anything. if you aim your skillshot correctly you will hit 95% of the times.

I was playing 2v5 bots so both me and my friend had to go vs 2 and yet both of us could 1v9.



>it's impossible to 1v2 beginner bots with most champs if u are low elo while it's fairly possible to 1v2 actual low elo players.


Yes... this is true. A new player will have trouble doing a 1v2 against bots with a difficulty meant for new players.

Ofcourse a smurf will be able to 1v2. I dont see what your point is here

i am not a smurf i find bots harder than real players because they almost never miss skillshots
you have to keep in mind that you are using a champion you are not good at ofc u'd be to 1v9 with ur main

Your last game was almost 300 days ago
https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/summoner/na/LuxButt99

I can 1v9 on the majority champs (a few supports are simply too weak)

If you find the bots harder than real players then the bots were a success for giving players a place to learn. Gotta learn to dodge better :)

You cant just hop into a game and expect to be able to 1v2, no champion is strong enough to do that on level 1. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

this account just to post on boards 

https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/summoner/euw/LetMeAfkPlss

yeah it's good practice but it's so frustrating that it feels impossible

if i didn't suck i would be able to 1V2 beginner bots...
everyone is fucking trolling when they play this game i fucking swear it.

> [{quoted}](name=LuxButt99,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=58l39xHb,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-07-16T10:17:54.159+0000)
>
> it's impossible to 1v2 beginner bots with most champs

Are intermediate easier than beginner? Because I can go 1v5 against intermediate bots and win. I also go Bot instead of Mid, so 1v2 for the first few minutes of the game.
Why am I able to beat 5 bots alone if they are so hard? Am I God? Eh... maybe the bots aren't that hard.
because u play summoner rift

You're telling me if I hop into a game against 3 bots by myself, in Twisted Treeline, I won't be able to win?
Is that a challenge?

i am not telling u anything relax
but it would be fun to see u try so do it

As someone who lives and breathes low elo play, I can say this isn't quite accurate. My average KDA in normals is like 3:1 lifetime. My average KDA against even _hard_ bots sits closer to 28:1. It basically comes down to learning their patterns. Once you've learned them, they become a ton easier because you can predict most of what they'll do.
can you 1v2 bots in twisted treeline? i guess i just suck but i still think they are not fit for beginners :/

> [{quoted}](name=LuxButt99,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=58l39xHb,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-07-16T10:39:18.116+0000)
>
> can you 1v2 bots in twisted treeline? i guess i just suck but i still think they are not fit for beginners :/

I'm actually not sure if I've tried Twisted Treeline since they upgraded the bot AI way back, so it's possible the TT bots are much trickier.

the lux bot is a real sniper
lmao guess we'll never know since i am one of the few people who actually play this mode

> [{quoted}](name=LuxButt99,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=58l39xHb,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-07-16T10:46:32.563+0000)
>
> the lux bot is a real sniper
> lmao guess we'll never know since i am one of the few people who actually play this mode

The bots always aim their skills directly at you, so if you are moving left/right of them and not right up on them then they will always miss you.

Bots also play extremely aggressively so if you are 1v2 against them just sit under your turret until you have a couple levels on them. That is the main reason players only send one person top lane, if the single person that is against the 2 has a chance to out level them because they aren't sharing exp then they just win. Usually you can beat them at level 3-4 ish but if you are new you might want to wait till 6 for your ult. 

Also, they may try to dive under your turret, if they do just use a stun or snare or some other cc and often they will just die or have to go back giving you breathing room.

> [{quoted}](name=LuxButt99,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=58l39xHb,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-07-16T10:46:32.563+0000)
>
> the lux bot is a real sniper
> lmao guess we'll never know since i am one of the few people who actually play this mode

I used to, but then they changed LeBlanc. To be honest, it's more fun than Rift, I just wish the wait times weren't so long.
oh, yeah it sucks to wait too long we have faster wait times in euw but i think even na has fast queue times for beginner bots because people are farming tokens currently not sure tho

You think beginner bots are difficult?
Then I guess you never played against bots in dota 2.

If youre unable to win every single game against beginner bots, regardless of the level, you should rly consider playing another game.
